```{r , setup, include = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

Graphing flags of the world in ggplot, because why not?  

# North America

## United States 

There are no stars in ggplot... 
```{r, echo = FALSE, , warning = FALSE, fig.height = 3, fig.width = 5}
# flag dimensions 
l <- 140
h_lim <- l*(1/1.9)
# union dimensions
union_l <- l*(.76/1.9)
union_h <- (h_lim - (l*(1/1.9) - (l*(1/1.9))*.5385)) - .54
# bar spacing and location 
bar_seq <- seq(1, l*(1/1.9), length.out = 14)
bars <- c(bar_seq, rep(0, (140-length(bar_seq))))
# star spacing
star6_l <- union_l*(.063/.76)
star6_h <- union_h*(.054/.5385) 
# star locations by row
star6_x <- c(star6_l*seq(1,11,2), rep(NA, 140-6))
star5_x <- c(star6_l*seq(2,10,2), rep(NA, 140-5))
row1_y <- c(rep(star6_h, 6), rep(NA, 140-6))
row2_y <- c(rep(star6_h*2, 5), rep(NA, 140-5))
row3_y <- c(rep(star6_h*3, 6), rep(NA, 140-6))
row4_y <- c(rep(star6_h*4, 5), rep(NA, 140-5))
row5_y <- c(rep(star6_h*5, 6), rep(NA, 140-6))
row6_y <- c(rep(star6_h*6, 5), rep(NA, 140-5))
row7_y <- c(rep(star6_h*7, 6), rep(NA, 140-6))
row8_y <- c(rep(star6_h*8, 5), rep(NA, 140-5))
row9_y <- c(rep(star6_h*9, 6), rep(NA, 140-6))

tibble(x = 1:l, 
       y = 1:l) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
  geom_point(col = "white") + 
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white")) +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, h_lim)) + 
  # theme_void() + 
  geom_segment(x = rep(1, 140), xend = rep(l, 140), y = bars, yend = bars, col = 'white') +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[1], ymax = bars[2], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[3], ymax = bars[4], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[5], ymax = bars[6], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[7], ymax = bars[8], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[9], ymax = bars[10], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[11], ymax = bars[12], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = bars[13], ymax = bars[14], fill = "#BF0A30")) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 1, xmax = union_l, ymin = h_lim - union_h, ymax = h_lim), fill = "#002868") + 
  # top row
  geom_point(aes(x = star6_x, y = h_lim - row1_y), col = 'white', size = 3) + 
  # second row
  geom_point(aes(x = star5_x, y = h_lim - row2_y), col = 'white', size = 3)  +
  # third row
  geom_point(aes(x = star6_x, y = h_lim - row3_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # fourth row
  geom_point(aes(x = star5_x, y = h_lim - row4_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # fifth row
  geom_point(aes(x = star6_x, y = h_lim - row5_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # sixth row
  geom_point(aes(x = star5_x, y = h_lim - row6_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # seventh row
  geom_point(aes(x = star6_x, y = h_lim - row7_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # eighth row
  geom_point(aes(x = star5_x, y = h_lim - row8_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  # ninth row
  geom_point(aes(x = star6_x, y = h_lim - row9_y), col = 'white', size = 3) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#BF0A30", "white")) +
  theme(legend.position = "none",
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank()) +
  labs(x = "", y = "")

```

# Europe

##  France 

```{r, echo = FALSE,  fig.height = 3, fig.width = 5}
l <- 140
h_lim <- l*(1/1.9)
line_seq <- seq(1, l, length.out = 4)

tibble(x = 1:l, 
       y = 1:l) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
  geom_point(col = "white") + 
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, h_lim)) +
  geom_segment(x = line_seq[2], xend = line_seq[2], y = 1, yend = h_lim, col = 'white') +
  geom_segment(x = line_seq[3], xend = line_seq[3], y = 1, yend = h_lim, col = 'white') +
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white")) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 1, xmax = line_seq[2], ymin = 1, ymax = h_lim), fill = "#183883") +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = line_seq[2], xmax = line_seq[2], ymin = 1, ymax = h_lim), fill = "#FFFFFF") +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = line_seq[3], xmax = line_seq[4], ymin = 1, ymax = h_lim), fill = "#DA251E") +
  theme(legend.position = "none",
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank()) +
  labs(x = "", y = "")

```
